The leader of Hong Kong Pro-independence group “Hong Kong National Party“ Mr. Chan Ho Tin was arrested at night on 29th August when leaving for Tokyo at Hong Kong Airport. He was suspected of “organizing riot” and “violence against the police” and has not yet been released.
Mr. Chan’s arrest is just one example of a series of oppressive actions by the Hong Kong SAR government and the police, followed by the arrest of the leaders Joshua Wong and Agnes Chow, leaders of the pro-democracy protest “Umbrella Movement” in 2014 on 30th and the denial of the application for assembly for the proposed protest on 31st August. It is also said that the regime aims to escalate the situation in the city for legitimatizing martial law enforcement and limiting civil liberties without assistance from China’s PLA. As citizens of Hong Kong, we hereby swear that we will never succumb to any arbitrary arrest and surreptitious oppression by the regime.
We can no longer tolerate or condone any daily violence and oppression carried out by the regime. Though we did not enjoy full democracy during British rule, at least our safety and liberties were guaranteed. As citizens who have been breathing the air of freedom for decades in this city, we solemnly condemn this kind of infringement on human rights and we are willing to, by sacrificing Hong Kong’s economic interests and status, defend our freedoms and fight till the end.

As citizens of Hong Kong, we hereby swear that we will never succumb to any arbitrary arrest and surreptitious oppression by the regime.
We can no longer tolerate or condone any daily violence and oppression carried out by the regime. Though we did not enjoy full democracy during British rule, at least our safety and liberties were guaranteed. As citizens who have been breathing the air of freedom for decades in this city, we solemnly condemn this kind of infringement on human rights and we are willing to, by sacrificing Hong Kong’s economic interests and status, defend our freedoms and fight till the end.
